humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor, which is 1.4 cm. According to the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is described as '1.4 CM IN GREATEST DIMENSION AS MEASURED ON THE SLIDE' in part 8A of the report. Therefore, based on the T stage criteria, this cancer is a T2, as T2 tumors are between 2 cm and 5 cm in size.
